snippet: The Fish and Wildlife Service wants to eliminate the endangered-species restrictions on gray wolves, but the plan was quickly greeted with criticism by conservationists.
abstract: Obama administration says gray wolves who prowl through northern Rockies and in forests along the Great Lakes no longer need endangered-species protection; Fish and Wildlife Service unveils proposal to eliminate remaining restrictions across country; environmental groups criticize decision, saying it will hinder further expansion wolves' current range.
lead_paragraph: The Fish and Wildlife Service wants to eliminate the endangered-species restrictions on gray wolves, but the plan was quickly greeted with criticism by conservationists.

headline.main: Federal Protection of Gray Wolves May Be Lifted, Agency Says
headline.print_headline: Federal Protection of Gray Wolves May Be Lifted, Agency Says
